wiki.content: "The Winner Takes It All", originally titled "The Story of My Life", was written by both Björn Ulvaeus and Benny Andersson, with Fältskog singing the lead vocal. The lyrics to the song were thought to mirror the divorce between Ulvaeus and Fältskog in 1979. However, Ulvaeus himself denies this, saying the basis of the song "is the experience of a divorce, but it's fiction. There wasn't a winner or a loser in our case. A lot of people think it's straight out of reality, but it's not". According to The Winner Takes It All Songfacts, Ulvaeus has said that while he usually didn't use drugs or alcohol while writing, he had a bottle of brandy next to him while writing the lyrics for this song. It was very personal to him. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "The Winner Takes It All", originally titled "The Story of My Life", was written by both Björn Ulvaeus and Benny Andersson, with Fältskog singing the lead vocal. The lyrics to the song were thought to mirror the divorce between Ulvaeus and Fältskog in 1979. However, Ulvaeus himself denies this, saying the basis of the song "is the experience of a divorce, but it's fiction. There wasn't a winner or a loser in our case. A lot of people think it's straight out of reality, but it's not".

track.name: The Winner Takes It All
comments: He may not have written this about their divorce....but she sang it about her divorce. Possibly the best vocal performance of all time.
Full of drama a song for the theatre or a greek tragedy.
There are no winners, everyone loses something. Eventually we realise this when there is nothing left to be done.

There's no comparison between ABBA'S song and Kate Bush's classic number 1 song.

The latter was merely poetry placed in to a moody melodic dramatic ballad.
A little advice for you all. Don't play this straight after Wuthering Heights. I'm in bits.
Classic sad love song which strikes a chord with anybody who has experienced such pain in a torn love situation.
lembro do Karaoke do Panico! kkkkkkkkkkkk
This is my favourite popsong of all times - and it still is in 2013!
This is the best Agnetha's vocal performance ever.
